title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt Nintendo Switch review - still one of the best games ever made
text:
Hack, slash, chop, blast a fireball, stir my pasta, dodge those lunging talons, taste the bolognese, chop off the monster’s head to collect my bounty.

This is the third time I’ve fought jumped into the shoes of Geralt of Rivia to battle the enormous griffin plaguing the wartorn settlement of White Orchard. I’ve done so in 4K on my PS4, I’ve replayed it with a suped-up gaming PC with a friend, but I can’t say I ever expected to do it while standing in my kitchen cooking dinner.

The first time I played the Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, the Switch was merely a twinkle in Nintendo’s eye. And even back then I hoped with all my heart that Nintendo’s rumoured new console would prove powerful enough to play it. As the little console’s internal specs and systems started to be revealed, drip by drip in early 2017, these hopes were almost certain to be dashed.

The Switch looked like a fantastic console, I thought, but it would never be able to run a game this dense, this gorgeous, or this intricate. Two and a half years later, consider my hat officially eaten.

For those who’ve somehow managed to avoid this game since it first launched on PC, PS4, and Xbox One, you’ve missed a treat. Simply put, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is one of the best games ever made.
